titleStmt.title: Seven propositions sent from the Parliament of Scotland to the Parliament of England; concerning the Kings Majesty, and the citizens of London, touching their priviledge and liberties. With other particulars of great concernment. Brought by Lieutenant Colonell Marshall, and presented to the Honourable House of Commons upon Wednesday last, May the 3. 1648. Together with his speech at the delivering thereof. And the proceedings of both Houses thereupon. Likewise, a letter from his Excellency the Lord Generall to the House of Commons, concerning the citizens of London, and their late petition.

Seven propositions sent from the Parliament of Scotland to the Parliament of England; concerning the Kings Majesty, and the citizens of London, touching their priviledge and liberties. With other particulars of great concernment. Brought by Lieutenant Colonell Marshall, and presented to the Honourable House of Commons upon Wednesday last, May the 3. 1648. Together with his speech at the delivering thereof. And the proceedings of both Houses thereupon. Likewise, a letter from his Excellency the Lord Generall to the House of Commons, concerning the citizens of London, and their late petition.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
